alert.note: Alert for Sanilac; St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 6:55PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sanilac and north central St. Clair Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 655 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Melvin, or near Yale, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Croswell and Applegate around 710 PM EDT. Lexington around 715 PM EDT. Port Sanilac around 720 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Roseburg, Amador, Birch Beach, Valley Center and Lexington Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
